data.name: Split number into multiple numbers by proportionals
data.description:
Your task is to split a number into multiple numbers by proportionals like this:
split_number(integer=100, proportionals=[1/3, 1/3, 1/3]) -> [34, 33, 33]
Input data:
— Integer, -1000 <= integer <= 1000.
— Proportionals, 0.000 <= proportional <= 1.000, Sum(Proportionals) ≈ 1, 0 <= Length(Proportionals) <= 12, type(proportional) is Decimal.
Output data:
— List of numbers, Sum(List of numbers) = Integer (if Sum(Proportionals) ≈ 1).
If Proportionals is empty, return []. If integer is a negative number, then the algorithm must work with it as a non-negative one, but multiply every number in list by -1. Example #1. 
integer = 916
proportionals = [0.53, 0.47]
916 * 0.53 = 485.48
916 * 0.47 = 430.52

We remove the fractional parts of the numbers and sum up:
485 + 430 = 915
We need to add 1 to get the integer = 916.
We look at the resulting fractional parts (0.48 and 0.52) and determine which number we have to round to get the integer = 916.
(0.52 > 0.48)
We round up 430.52 -> 431.

485 + 431 = 916. Done.
Result = [485, 431]
Example #2. 
integer = 2
proportionals = [0.1, 0.4, 0.3, 0.2]
2 * 0.1 = 0.2
2 * 0.4 = 0.8
2 * 0.3 = 0.6
2 * 0.2 = 0.4

We remove the fractional parts of the numbers and sum up:
0 + 0 + 0 + 0 = 0
We need to add 2 to get the integer = 2.
We look at the resulting fractional parts (0.2, 0.8, 0.6, 0.4) and determine which numbers we have to round to get the integer = 2.
(0.8 > 0.6 > 0.4 > 0.2)
We round up 0.8 -> 1. We have to add another 1 to get the integer = 2.
We round up 0.6 -> 1. Done.
Result = [0, 1, 1, 0]
Note. If the fractional parts are equal, the first one is chosen.
